intro: Acaena adenocarpa, commonly known as the hairy burr bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, spiny bracts that form burrs. The plant produces small white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of the distinctive, prickly fruits. Acaena adenocarpa is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.

Acaena adenocarpa plays an important ecological role in its native environment.
